meanings.definition: The act or process of involving or entangling
meanings.sent1: The involutions of the mystery kept us guessing until the end.
meanings.sent2: The involutions of the plot made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent3: The involutions of the game led to a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: Her involutions of logic were like a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The involutions of the maze were confusing but exciting.

meanings.definition: A complex or intricate process or situation
meanings.sent1: The involutions of bureaucracy can be frustrating.
meanings.sent2: The involutions of the case required careful analysis.
meanings.sent3: The involutions of the party planning were unexpectedly challenging.
meanings.sent4: Navigating the involutions of relationships can be tricky.
meanings.sent5: The involutions of the puzzle were mind-boggling.

meanings.definition: A mathematical operation that is its own inverse
meanings.sent1: In mathematics, involutions are fascinating operations.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the involutions in algebra can be enlightening.
meanings.sent3: The involutions in the equation seemed to cancel each other out.
meanings.sent4: The concept of involutions in math is like a mirror reflection.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the involutions with clarity and simplicity.
